Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LeiliI
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the second time in september 2010. The hotel is comfortable. T he rooms are quite small but clean. Lobby was a bit small but had very comfortable sofas. Breakfast was ok and the variety of the stuff served was limited. The lights in the corridors went on and off automatically and unless you huried you would have to walk In the dark. People at reception are not friendly but will help you. There was no complimentary fruit on the arrival day as was mentioned in the website. The location is superb. There was free internet connection with high speed. Overall it was a pleasent stay and considering the price I would recommend this hotel to people who won't spend much time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BASE FOR EXPLORATION”
Reviews.Author: Grampasauras
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for over a week and it was fine. Very busy with a lot of coming and going in the lobby and consequently the lifts took a while to arrive sometimes. We had a room each which was excellent but they were probably a bit small for sharing - not much storage space either. Cleaned daily though, plenty of hot water but never did work out the air conditioning system!!! The Buffet Style Breakfast was plentiful enough, and again always very busy, but I thought pretty limited in choice compared to Golden Age 1. However it did set you up for the day's exploring. We did try lunch once and again it was buffet style and OK. A steak sandwich I ordered at the bar one evening though was pretty hard work and I never repeated that. Found the staff helpful enough once they understood what was required and that could be a bit frustrating but, to be fair, the majority of guests were not English speakers either. View from the room was better than Golden Age 1 but just roof tops and not very picturesque except maybe at sunset? As most people have said can't fault the location but I never did find the swimming pool........

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, top location, noisy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: clownshoes
Reviews.Content: A very busy property, this one. With the pool, gym, sauna, well-appointed rooms, 24hr reception, bar, gift shop, free wi-fi and proper restaurant, this hotel deserves it's four stars.Â  The location can not be beat, two blocks from Taksim Square. Central, right amongst all the restaurants, nightlife, banks, other hotels, and cafes. Of course this means your only issue is going to be noise. Street noise is a bit of a problem, as my double-glazed window allowed more sound in than expected. The walls and doors are thin, so it was easy to hear the elevator outside, and the young men entertaining themselves in the corridors after a few refreshing after-dinner beverages. The breakfast room is very busy. A large buffet serves Turkish breakfast items - olives, spiced cheese, many salad items, lentil soup. The usual Euro pastries and some cereals are present, along with tea, coffee and juice. A solid breakfast but nothing extraordinary or memorable. The service I received was very good. For example, my room was without towels upon arrival. After a call to housekeeping, the towels were delivered within two minutes. Did I mention free wi-fi? Fast too, available in most rooms, no silly log-in, receipts to collect or time-out.

Reviews.Title: “Inadequate, poor room quality”
Reviews.Author: badb0ys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with my wife for three nights. Our room was on the seventh floor. The room was small but had a great view of one part of the city. The noise from the traffic though was very loud, could even hear it with the windows closed. The mattress was awful. Very old, hard, and almost broken in some places, gave us both bad back aches. The breakfast was nice, a large variety to choose from, and all good. The overall impression of our stay could have been better, but the terrible beds ruined it for us. And it was the same in another room as well, we checked with our friends who were staying in the same floor. Ok for once, never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient for night life and sightseeing in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LejlaH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Golden Age 2 for three nights last week and I was plesantly surprised. The first room we were given was noisy and we asked to have it changed and then got a room with the most magnificent view of Istanbul. The second one was alo much bigger and beds were more comfortable. The hotel has perfect location, just few minutes walk from Taksim square, Metro station, and Taksim night life. The street is very safe which makes it a perfect hotel should you wanna explore Taksim night life. As taxi is relatively cheep in Istanbul, you can easily get to any other part. The service was very good, with staff friendly and helpful. I did not get a chance to try breakfast simply because of the variety of food Istanbul offers and I always feel sorry to eat hotel food. In general it was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good location,normal services”
Reviews.Author: h1361b
Reviews.Content: Comparing with 4 star hotels around the world,I think,you should consider most of Istanbul 4 star hotels as a 3 star ones. In my experience at Golden Age 2 hotel,most of the services and conditions are average.Rooms are not luxury and unfortunately we couldn't open the window cuzz the exhaust fans were just below the window and made too much noise but Breakfast was good enough. At the all it was ok with me and my family,especially regard to it's location so near to Taksim square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Cancerian76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights recently and really liked it. This is undoubtedly the best place to stay in Istanbul as is so conveniently located to Metro, Tour Buses, Airport Shuttle and above all walking distance to Taksim Square & the famous Istiklal Street. The area around is so lively and interesting that you can't be bored at all...late night coffee and walk is must while you stay here. The hotel itself is also nice, comfortable and staff is very very comfortable and helpful. They had free wi-fi and buffet breakfast was amazing. Rooms were also spacious with appropriate accessories and good wash-room. I would certainly recommend this hotel to fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average on all the other”
Reviews.Author: Gadgetakias
Reviews.Content: Beside the great location near the Taksim square, all the rest are average on this hotel. Expensive and definatelly not a 4 stars hotel. Old rooms, noisy neighbourhood, below average cleaning. Breakfast was awful. Personnel speaks barely some English.

Reviews.Title: “Pefectly located and exceptional value in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: khalaf007
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel twice now and also stayed at this hotel group's newer outpost, the Avantgarde Hotel which is SUPERB although located in a less central location. Check it out also: http://www.avantgardehotel.com For the location as an occasional tourist to Istanbul, this is an excellent place to have as a base. As in all the hotels at this chain, the service is truly beyond the call of normal duty. Everyone who works here is genuinely happy and always has the time to stop what they are doing to help guests. This alone would be a good reason to stay here. The rooms were well appointed, clean and modern. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a base for a few days from which you could explore the city from such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't like this hotel and wouldn't come back again”
Reviews.Author: SNR79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Golden Age II Hotel Istanbul. Despite it 4 stars hotel the service level hardly reaches 3 stars. We stayed in the triple room and the hotel provides tea and coffee in the room that is included in the room charge. But there were only two tea cups. When I asked reception for the third one as we are three people and occupy triple room, I was told that it's a standard set of two tea cups despite it's two people or three. I was surprised and asked shall we drink tea in order - like two people drink tea and third one waits when when another one finishes to drink, so he can drink the tea from that cup???? The receptionist said - "yes, that is the only way to do it", as the third cup won't be given. Next day room service didn't put the bottle of water and it took me five times call to reception asking them to bring the water in the room, which is also included in the room charge. Finally the brought it ... at 7p.m. The breakfast is from 7 to 10 am, however we were asked to come to the breakfast as earlier as possible, if we're late there won't be enough food ????? Once we came at 09:30 at breakfast the tea, juices, eggs, bred etc were finished. There is no guest relation coordinator in the hotel. His duties was carried out by luggage carrying person???? The room is very tiny an the location is very noisy. We visit Is Istanbul quite often but we won't come to this hotel anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: thepinheiros
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one week during our honeymoon in 2010. The two best things about this hotel: - Great location: very close to Taksim, subway/funiculaire stations, Istikal Street - Great Staff - everything we asked them, they were very happy to provide us with info, tips, maps, etc. Good breakfast. Also, there was no free internet but they let us use the computer in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “good location & friendly personels”
Reviews.Author: Greenleaf2211
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located near taksim square with about 5 minutes far from the sauare by walk. the location is good and safe for solo travellers. i stayed 7 days in this hotel and the personels had freindly behavor. the room was comfortable and nice view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: trip_architect
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul with a group of students from my school during our summer holidays. Our main interest was to visit all the Byzantine and Ottoman monuments with our professor who was the best guide we could ever hope for. We mainly moved around by bus, but the hotel is situated near Taksim square, which you can access easily by metro and cable car. Taksim square seems, also, to be the heart of modern Istanbul, with many young locals and tourists walking up and down the surrounding streets, visiting small boutiques, having lunch or dinner at the numerous restaurants, going for shopping, or just enjoying a late night out at the numerous bars and cafes. The hotel is situated at the borders of a no car zone at the area, so it is very easy for a visitor to walk around, but one should always be very careful when crossing the roads around Taksim square, since there is heavy traffic all day round. The staff was very helpful and they would carry all our luggage from the bus to the hotel's reception hall. Checking in was a smooth and fast procedure and we finally got in our room in very few moments from the time we entered the hotel. Even though there was a mix up and we were allocated a double instead of a twin room, the room was quite nice and comfortable. After speaking with the receptionist we had a new twin room from the next day onwards. The only bad thing was that we had a view towards the inner side of the block, so the view was limited to the people staying at an other hotel, but other people from our group were lucky enough to get rooms with a fantastic city view. That is also the main pro of this hotel, since it is the first one at the top of the hill and there are no other taller buildings obscuring the view from the rooms towards the city. Nevertheless, the room was very comfortable, and clean. The bathroom was quite large, especially the shower was so big that nearly three or four people could fit in there. Breakfast was served at a restaurant on the first floor. Even though relatively smaller than other breakfast areas I have been to at other hotels in Turkey, the atmosphere was lovely, and the food was great. There was a big variety of bread with many different flavours and ingredients, as well as a big variety of cooked choices. Truly, a great way to start your day. I personally didn't use the fitness centre, but some friends of mine did, and from how they have described it to me, I would rate it as an average one. Certainly the swimming pool was more like a children's swimming pool. It was so small that I did't even thought of using it, but it was suitably located at the basement of the hotel, so I think that it would be nice for someone to go straight from the fitness centre to the swimming pool for a relaxing short swim. Overall, we didn't go to Istanbul to stay in the hotel for five days. It was greatly located for us, since we were using a bus every day, but it could be a challenge walking all the way up the hill from the old city, especially for someone who wouldn't like to use the metro and the cable car. But generally it was nice and I would certainly recommend it to a group of young people for a short stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: imanipour
Reviews.Content: The location is good, But All other Things is not. Good 1. you can ear the breading of people in near room. The wall is so so thin and not sound proof. you can not sleep in room. 2. The rooms is so so small and that is not suitable for two persons. 3. The Rooms is so so hot and air condition system is not working properly. 4. The pool is so so small and fitness tools is not working properly. 5. The room service is so bad, and they will not change towels and .... 6. you can find better choice in Taksim or SoltanAhmat Area. 7. staff is not good

Reviews.Title: “just forget it...”
Reviews.Author: Kaveh_11
Reviews.Content: As a 3 star hotel the facilities are so bad, the rooms are so tiny and the wardrobe is suitable for one person. the southern room views are all to some old and some how destroyed buildings. the receptionists are so bad tempered and hardly know English. the pool is so small and is located under the ground in a dark and misty hall. the breakfast wasn't good as well, there were some kind of colored waters as juice! the only thing that made me a bit satisfied was the location that was so close to the taxim Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Just an ordinary hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: rezaghgh
Reviews.Content: I just come back from Isyanbul and stay 3 nights in Golden 2 here you can find all advantages and disadvantages of the hotel as follow: ADVANTAGES: -great location just few minuts by walk to Taksim Sq and Istiklal Caddeci -The buffect breakfast was great -The lobby is clean and cofortable - rooms equipped with safe deposit boxes DISADVANTAGES: -the rooms are too thiny and small -Most of the room views is not good -The check in was too late -The recieptions dont now how to smile and I think a training course should be done by Ms Gullar (Best receiption in hotel) to learn how to be helpful althogh the other lady in recieption was helpful -room cleaning would not be done regularely every morning If problems with recieption can resolve I would recommend this hotel Swimming pool is very small and you have to wear hair cap

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BubbleSnow
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Taskim but 10 mins away to avoid the busy area. 5 mins away from metro station. Front desk staff and building maintenance staff are very helpful. Room is a little small though.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so friendly and helpful, it made our stay special”
Reviews.Author: MaieH
Reviews.Content: My Best friend and I arrived at the Hotel on a Sunday, August 1, 2010 at around 8am. Check in is at 12.00 and we were very tired (just flown in from Beirut, Lebanon), the Staff were so friendly and helpful, they tried to get us a room ASAP. We got our room around 11am. They invited us to have Breakfast, which was a generous gesture since it was not part of our package from the first day. We had done our research before our travel, so we knew where we wanted to go and on what days. But how to get there?? mmm........ we asked the staff at the Hotel Reception who were delighted to realize how informed we were. They told us "take this Bus, Bus # X, and then go to this station, take the Tram from here to here" very clear directions and helpful info for how to get to where we wanted to go. Breakfast was very varied, light and delicious. We had their breakfast every morning, it was part of our package deal, and we enjoyed it alot. We made friends with the waiters, and they helped out my friend with her Turkish (she made a good effort to learn the Language and got plenty of help, which really helped us on our trip) the waiters were delighted to hear my friend speak the language and gave her lessons each morning. The rooms were very comfortable, more or less spacious, and with a very clean, modern bathroom. We did not like the safety deposit box so we did not use it. and the Closet was small with one sliding door so you couldn't close both sides at the same time. But I found the space comfortable and we had nice evenings sitting on the round table and chatting. We checked out the Spa and Pool but didn't use it. It is clean, modern and nice, but not large by other standards. As a general Review, we really felt this hotel was our Home in Istanbul, because of the comfortable facilities and the very friendly staff. We both decided on our second trip to Istanbul, to book here again!!! Thank you Golden Age 2 !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price , Nice Place , Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: elyar
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to Taksim Square where you can find Metro and Bus stations and taxi ... this is not a luxury hotel but very good for its price ... clean and simple and polite staff ... most of tourists in it are Iranians ... breakfast is good ... totally i am satisfied by staying in this hotel ... the price is very reasonable too ...

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: arioak
Reviews.Content: If you intend to enjoy the city and not to spend time in the hotel, this hotel can be a good choice, the location is perfect. It is nearly a 3 star, the rooms are small though but enough for a business traveler or those who want to be out most of the time. The breakfast is ok, not so many varieties but not bad either. If you are traveling with the family and you think you spend some time in the hotel, you'd better look for another hotel but no worries if you have no other options.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: kuwaitbutterfly
Reviews.Content: it was the worst hotel i stayed in the room are like a bird cage they dony have baby cot so our children sleep in the bed with us there was a blood on the bathroom towels the room service was the worst they even dont have iron for clothes i had to wear my clothes without ironing i payed for a week in this hotel and i only stayed 5 days i checked out because i cant stay more

Reviews.Title: “It ruined our enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was gr8 in Taxim, near Taxim square!! Yet, some of the rooms were overlooking horrible sites. The room service was okay, but the buffet was not goood!! The air conditionars were not working and when we went to complain the administation of the hotel were not all were extremely rude. The bathroom untinsels working well. The room was clean to a certain extent, but it was not well lit!!

HotelInfo.Name: Golden Age 2
HotelInfo.Address: Abdulhakhamit 40-42 | Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
